DOC.HEAD: Key Events in Drunken-Driving Crash That Killed 27
With PM-Bus Crash Trial, Bjt
DOC.TEXT: Here is a chronology of key events in the nation's worst drunken-driving disaster:

May 14 _ Church bus from Radcliff, Ky., carrying 67 people collides with pickup traveling the wrong way on Interstate 71 near Carrollton, Ky. Fiery crash kills 27 people _ 24 of them children. May 16 _ Larry Mahoney, a chemical plant worker who drove the pickup, is charged with 27 counts of capital murder. Authorities say Mahoney had a blood-alcohol level nearly 2{ times the legal limit. May 19 _ Thousands gather on high school football field in Radcliff to mourn victims; funerals begin. May 20 _ Mahoney pleads innocent to charges; Kentucky begins crackdown on drunken drivers and offers free safety inspection of private buses. July 22 _ Carroll County grand jury indicts Mahoney on 27 counts of wanton murder. Aug. 2-4 _ National Transportation Safety Board holds hearing on bus crash in Louisville. Oct. 10 _ Mahoney released from jail on $540,000 property and cash bond.

March 29 _ National Transportation Safety Board releases findings, saying Kentucky needs tougher drunken driving laws and that states should set a date for school buses not meeting 1977 federal standards. May 14 _ First anniversary of bus crash marked by ceremonies held in memory of the victims. Monument in their honor unveiled at Radcliff cemetery. June 3 _ Federal officials approve highway signs marking the crash site on I-71. Nov. 8 _ Mahoney's trial begins with jury selection. Nov. 20 _ Testimony begins. Dec. 14 _ Mahoney takes the stand, says he's sorry for the bus crash and deaths he is accused of causing. Dec. 21 _ After deliberating for 11 hours, jury convicts Mahoney of 27 counts of second-degree manslaughter, one count of drunken driving, 12 counts of assault and 41 counts of wanton endangerment. Jury begins deliberating what sentence to recommend.
